Author: jl777c#5810
Content: certainly some part is by people that hold against the entire project the agama hack, but by and large people are very happy to find out their coins ended up in the sweep address vs. the hacker address. for the latter, they are all quite surprised that they still get a refund

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: i know there are no guarantees in crypto, but i try to demonstrate that we will do what we can within our powers

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: with 1000 people affected, that is 1000 that now have a more secure setup and hopefully a lot more that dodged a bullet are taking security more seriously.

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: the hackers are after your crypto

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: it is up to you to make sure it it secured. we have all seen that CEX are not really able to keep it that secure, anybody that thinks govts or banks can... the amount of money being stolen from banks each year, seems to be something that is tried to be hidden. it doesnt matter so much as insurance and the "printing presses" just replace it anyway

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: i strongly urge everybody to store all their crypto on dedicated hardware, be is some unix laptop or hardware wallets. the node that has your passphrase should not be running any unknown software at all.

Author: Markus#5464
Content: CEX should just do like bitmex and it would be more secure....let ppl withdraw once a day and let CEX keep all funds in cold storages

Author: Markus#5464
Content: sure maybe not as nice since u can just withdraw once a day but more secure for sure

Author: Markus#5464
Content: that way they can validate if withdraws are valid or if there is any suspicious activity before the withdraw is getting processed
